body_html: Yeah, we have to support Python 2. We also should even be hesitant to make the hybrid frontend look different across 2 and 3. Then people would need to learn 2 APIs. Not sure how I feel about # type: comments. It seems like a good solution for optional type checking, but not a great solution for required meta-data needed by the frontend.
body_text: Yeah, we have to support Python 2. We also should even be hesitant to make the hybrid frontend look different across 2 and 3. Then people would need to learn 2 APIs. Not sure how I feel about # type: comments. It seems like a good solution for optional  type checking, but not a great solution for required meta-data needed by the frontend.
body: Yeah, we have to support Python 2. We also should even be hesitant to make the hybrid frontend look different across 2 and 3. Then people would need to learn 2 APIs. Not sure how I feel about `# type:` comments. It seems like a good solution for optional  type checking, but not a great solution for required meta-data needed by the frontend.
